{"step_by_step_thinking": "Unstable angina is a type of angina pectoris, which is chest pain or discomfort that occurs when the heart muscle doesn't receive enough blood flow. It is considered 'unstable' because it is unpredictable and can occur at rest or with minimal exertion. The pain is typically severe and lasts longer than 10 minutes. It does not subside with rest and may even worsen. Therefore, the correct answer is D. All of the above.", "answer_choice": "D"}
